text.description: this token is used to color the active text (when the user types...) in the input fields

Canvas.description: For the background of your website or app.

Canvas Subtle.description: For the background of your website or app (e.g., when you create a card-based layout).

Surface.description: For the background area of components like headers or cards.

Surface Subtle.description: For the background area of components that should stand out somewhat against a white background.

Backdrop.description: For darkening the content under dialogs.

Surface Highlight.description: For backgrounds of components that should stand out from the rest of the content, such as the footer.

Disabled.description: Only for text in a disabled state.

Standard.description: For standard text displayed in black in both light and dark mode. This is mostly used when text is on a colored area that is light in both modes.

Additional.description: For standard text displayed in black in both light and dark mode. This is mostly used when text is on a colored area that is light in both modes.

Informational.description: For backgrounds of components that provide additional and helpful information, such as an informational notification, or functions such as save.

Standard.description: Inverted / standard is the inverse state of the default text color. For text displayed as inverted in the other mode (white in light mode and dark gray in dark mode).

Additional.description: Inverted / additional is the inverse state of the additional text color. For text displayed as inverted in the other mode (a darker gray in light mode and a lighter gray in dark mode).

Standard.description: For standard text displayed in white in both light and dark mode. This is mostly used when text is on a colored area that is identical in both modes, such as the primary button.

Additional.description: For supplementary text displayed in white in both light and dark mode. This is mostly used when text is on a colored area that is identical in both modes, such as the primary button.

Hovered.description: For backgrounds of components that inform about a failed action or error, such as the error notification, or functions like delete.

Standard.description: For backgrounds of components that inform about a failed action or error, such as the error notification, or functions like delete.

Subtle.description: For backgrounds of components that inform about a failed action or error, such as error notification.

Standard.description: For backgrounds of components that provide additional and helpful information, such as an informational notification, or functions such as save.

Subtle.description: For backgrounds of components that provide additional and helpful information, such as a success notification.

Standard.description: For backgrounds of components that confirm a successful action, such as a success notification, or for functions such as send, call, and activate.

Subtle.description: For backgrounds of components that confirm a successful action, such as a success notification.

Standard.description: For backgrounds of components that warn of potentially undesirable results, such as a warning notification.

Subtle.description: For backgrounds of components that warn of potentially undesirable results, such as a warning notification.

Standard.description: For outlined and ghost elements: The standard fill is invisible / 0% opacity

Hovered.description: For outlined and ghost elements: When hovered a light, transparent fill is applied

Pressed.description: For outlined and ghost elements: When pressed or active a medium transparent fill is applied

HoveredInverted.description: For outlined and ghost elements: When hovered a light, transparent fill is applied

PressedInverted.description: For outlined and ghost elements: When pressed or active a medium transparent fill is applied

base.description: this is the base font size
